description: |
  The BlockMesh object applies a 'brick' mesh to the Class.BasePart it is
  parented to. It behaves identically to a Class.SpecialMesh with
  Class.SpecialMesh.MeshType set to 'brick'.

  ## What does a BlockMesh do?

  A BlockMesh gives the Class.BasePart it was applied to a brick shaped mesh.
  It is identical in appearance to a standard Roblox Class.Part.

  The dimensions of the mesh will scale linearly in all directions with
  Class.BasePart.Size, this means a part containing a BlockMesh can be resized
  the same way as any other part.

  The additional functionality a BlockMesh brings however, is the ability to set
  the Class.DataModelMesh.Scale and Class.DataModelMesh.Offset properties.
  These allow the position and dimensions of the mesh that is displayed to be
  changed without changing the Class.BasePart.Position or
  Class.BasePart.Size of the Class.BasePart the mesh is parented to.

  Note as the Class.BlockMesh object does not include a texture the
  Class.DataModelMesh.VertexColor property does not do anything.
